_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY              

FACILITY POLICY:

The owner, management and employees of COGDILL FARM SUPPLY, INC. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, CRAWFORD COUNTY LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the enviroment and the surrounding public.

FACILITY INFORMATION:

The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers, Anhydrous ammonia is receied, stored, and distributed for direct application as nutrients for crop production.  The maximum quanity stored would be 260,000 pounds in a storage tank and nurse tanks.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:

The facility has been reviewed for general compliance with the provisions of  "Safety Requirements for the Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, k-61.1", published by the American National Standards Institute, ins.(ansi), and the standards of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia". The ANSI Standard has been adopted by reference by Iowa Administrative Code Part 21-Chapter 43-Rule 43.6(200)-Standard for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. The OSHA standard is referenced in the Registration Form Section 8.3{b}, and inspected and licensed by the IOWA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has the been any accidental releases resulting in off-site dieaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environment damage.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

The facility has a written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CRF 1910.38.

It has provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA):

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of the facility.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
